bug.short_desc: Project Cyrus IMAP web site is confusing and contradictory

long_desc.thetext:
There seem to be some flaws in the project Cyrus IMAP website.
* The main page has a link for a FAQ which is blank: http://cyrusimap.web.cmu.edu/faq.html shouldn't the link point here: http://cyrusimap.web.cmu.edu/twiki/bin/view/Cyrus/CyrusFAQ instead?
* The documentation link on the main page states, "The Cyrus documentation is primarily contained in the Cyrus Wiki." whereas the wiki states "The authoritative source for Cyrus documentation is in the doc/ directory inside of the distribution" Couldn't the main page state this directly and leave the wiki out of it?
* The Cyrus Documentation page on the wiki states "If you want to suggest a change, please suggest it on the cyrus-devel@lists.andrew.cmu.edu mailing list, or to cyrus-bugs@andrew.cmu.edu." whereas the CyrusBugzilla page states "We track all of the bugs / feature requests in Bugzilla. This is mostly because we are pretty forgetful and it helps us track issues specifically." Perhaps these two statements should be brought into agreement.
That's all for now.
Best regards, -nic
Again, these reports should be broken up into separate, actionable items.
web site is now a wiki, and you're invited to contribute improvements.
